title: The air conditioning system uses the bleed air from the pneu…
caption_en: The air conditioning system uses the bleed air from the pneumatic manifold. With the PACK switched on, the air flows through the Pack bi-level valve into the ECU or environmental control unit. Here in the ECU, the air is cooled before it enters the cabin and cockpit. _

title: Pack Bi-level Pressure Regulating and Shut-Off Valve The Pac…
caption_en: Pack Bi-level Pressure Regulating and Shut-Off Valve The Pack bi-level valve is controlled by the PACK switch on the Itis an electro-pneumatic valve and is powered by the DC Left Essential bus. It is electrically controlled and it requires pneumatic pressure to open. _

title: Just like the ECS PRSOV, itis also a Fail Safe OPEN valve. T…
caption_en: Just like the ECS PRSOV, itis also a Fail Safe OPEN valve. This means that it remains open if there is a loss of electrical power to the valve, provided air pressure is still available to keep it open. This ensures that air is still available for ventilation and pressurization. JN _

title: Itis also called a bi-level valve because it has 2 levels or…
caption_en: Itis also called a bi-level valve because it has 2 levels or modes of operation. These are the normal mode and the high flow mode. To open the pack valve, push the PACK switch. The OFF light on the switch will extinguish. JN _

title: The amount of bleed air flowing through the pack valve depen…
caption_en: The amount of bleed air flowing through the pack valve depends on the HI FLOW switch selection. In the normal mode, the HI FLOW switch is not selected on and a fixed air mass flows through the Pack bi-level valve. FE _

title: High Flow Mode If increased airflow and ventilation is requi…
caption_en: High Flow Mode If increased airflow and ventilation is required, select the HI FLOW switch on. The ON light on the switch illuminates together with an advisory CAS message PACK HI FLOW. _

title: The airplane flight manual or AFM requires that this High Fl…
caption_en: The airplane flight manual or AFM requires that this High Flow switch must be off for - all takeoffs and landings, - all flights above FL and - during anti-icing operations. J _
